channel.title: Need help burning videos to a disk
channel.description:
Have you ever heard of the workout program [b]P90x[/b]? Well I downloaded that from Demonoid and I'm really fit and run track and all that good stuff, and It looks pretty good. The concepts are really good, and some of the exercises work very good. One problem though... I need help burning them to a disk.
What program should I use? What disks should I use? And just stuff like that. Thanks for any help! ;)
And my computer is an [i]Intel Pentium(R) 4 CPU 1.90GHz 1.89GHz. 384Mb of RAM[/i] just in case you might of needed to know that.
~Mjordan~

item.title: Need help burning videos to a disk
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Bang Train, you might wanna try Gutsy…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help burning videos to a disk
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:8, topic:152182”][quote author=Bang Train link=topic=208151.msg1828425#msg1828425 date=1192687194]
wait? do you just want to burn them?

or convert them so they can play in a DVD player?
[/quote]Well both I guess. Burn them to a disk so I can play them on a DVD player.

And do you use Ubuntu Bang Train?[/quote]
dual boot, love it but it no loves my monitor and gfx card (it hates the widescreen i guess, waiting for the GUI for editing x.org)

Read full topic

item.title: Need help burning videos to a disk
item.dc:creator: @redragonje65 redragonje65
item.description:
@redragonje65 wrote:

I’ve got Nero. It works great. I can choose many differnt types of cds I want to burn. You should get it. It works great.
